# üê∞ get your bunny up

> Print a random ASCII bunny in your terminal 

![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Hare-white?style=for-the-badge&logo=data:image/png;base64,)

## üõ†Ô∏è Usage

#### Prerequisites
- [Hare programming language](https://harelang.org/) installed on your system, if building
- A Unix-like system (Linux, BSD, macOS)

#### Installation
- Clone the repository and run the install script:
```sh
git clone https://github.com/rakrab/get-your-bunny-up.git
# or, if connecting internally, use http://gitea.41.io/robert/get-your-bunny-up.git
cd get-your-bunny-up
chmod +x get-your-bunny-up
./get-your-bunny-up
```
- The install script will create a symlink in `~/.local/bin`

#### Usage
- Run the program to see a random bunny:
```sh
bunnyup
```
- Disable default bunnies (only show files from the `bunnies` folder):
```sh
bunnyup -nodefaults
```
- Add your own ASCII art by placing text files in the `bunnies` folder in the project directory
- To build the program from source, run `hare build -o bunnyup bunnyup.ha`
